title: 3 Easy Ways to Make Someone an Admin on Telegram + Fixes

steps.title: Tap the group you want to manage.
steps.content: Tap the group you want to manage. You can find this on the Telegram's home page. If you don't see your group, tap the magnifying glass icon to search for it.

steps.title: Tap the group’s photo.
steps.content: Tap the group’s photo. It’s at the top-right corner of the group. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Administrators.
steps.content: Tap Administrators . You can find this next to the green shield icon. You'll see a list of all current admins, including the group owner.

steps.title: Tap Add Admin.
steps.content: Tap Add Admin . This is at the top of the page, under the Channel Admins header.

steps.title: Tap the person you want to make an admin.
steps.content: Tap the person you want to make an admin. This selects that user. If you don't see the user you want to make admin, search for their name in the search field.

steps.title: Set permissions.
steps.content: Set permissions. Once you select a user, you'll see a list of permissions under the What can this admin do? header. To toggle off a permission, tap the switch so it turns red. To toggle on a permission, tap the switch so it turns green.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. The admin is now added.

steps.title: Tap the group you want to manage.
steps.content: Tap the group you want to manage. You can find this on the Telegram's home page. If you don't see your group, tap the magnifying glass icon to search for it.

steps.title: Tap the name of the group.
steps.content: Tap the name of the group. It’s at the top of the group.

steps.title: Long-press on the user you want to make admin.
steps.content: Long-press on the user you want to make admin. You'll see all members listed below the Notifications setting. A pop-up menu will open. If you don't see the user you want to make admin, search for their name in the search field or invite someone from your contacts .

steps.title: Tap Promote to admin.
steps.content: Tap Promote to admin . This is the first option.

steps.title: Set permissions.
steps.content: Set permissions. Once you select a user, you'll see a list of permissions under the What can this admin do? header. To toggle off a permission, tap the switch so it turns red. To toggle on a permission, tap the switch so it turns blue.

steps.title: Tap the checkmark.
steps.content: Tap the checkmark. This is in the top-right corner. The admin is now added.

steps.title: Open Telegram.
steps.content: Open Telegram. You can use the desktop app or website at https://web.telegram.org on your PC, Mac, or Chromebook. If you aren't already logged in, open Telegram on your mobile device. Go to Settings > Devices > Link Desktop Device . Then, scan the QR code on the website to confirm your login.

steps.title: Click the group you want to manage.
steps.content: Click the group you want to manage. This opens the group in the main panel. If you don't see your group, enter the name in the search bar.

steps.title: Click the group’s name.
steps.content: Click the group’s name. It’s at the top of the group. The right panel will open.

steps.title: Click the user you want to make admin.
steps.content: Click the user you want to make admin. You'll see users listed in the right panel, underneath the Notifications setting. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Set permissions.
steps.content: Set permissions. Once you select a user, you'll see a list of permissions under the What can this admin do? header. To toggle off a permission, click the switch so it turns grey. To toggle on a permission, click the switch so it turns purple.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . The selected member is now a group admin.

steps.title: Check your privacy settings.
steps.content: Check your privacy settings. If you can't make someone an admin, make sure they have allowed Everyone to invite them if they are not in your contacts. This setting can be found in Privacy and security > Groups and channels .

steps.title: Make sure the account is not restricted.
steps.content: Make sure the account is not restricted. Users may be marked as spam by Telegram's SpamBot, and they may be restricted from normal account actions. Check SpamBot for the account status, and if necessary, wait the appropriate amount of time for the restriction to lift.

steps.title: Contact Telegram support.
steps.content: Contact Telegram support. If you're still unable to make others admin on Telegram, this is likely a bug. You can send a support request directly on the Telegram website . Include a description of the issue, as well as your name, email, and phone number. [2] X Research source
